trustfund:
TF038949-CHINA - SPN XIAOLANGDI
            RESETTLEMENT PROJECT,TF040892-CHINA: XIAOLANGDI RESETTLEMENT PROJECTR

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. Lessons highlight the
            nature of this free-standing resettlement project the Bank
            has ever financed. This is reflected in the project
            objective, design principles, and whole implementation
            process, as well as the government's commitment to
            post-relocation support to the people resettled. Adequate
            institutional capacity and effective management systems were
            conditions for success: there was much knowledge and rich
            experience gained from previous operations, and extensive
            training provided. Likewise, independent supervision and
            monitoring mechanisms, proved to be important in reservoir
            resettlement management, which included an independent
            monitor, a resettlement supervisor, a public health monitor,
            an environment supervising engineer, and an international
            panel of experts. Paramount was the technical service of the
            project design institute, who continued its involvement in
            resettlement implementation as technical advisor, and
            reviewer of resettlement plans, and designs. Moreover, the
            reservoir resettlement followed a consultative, and
            participatory process for its design and implementation,
            adequately adopted in the project, enabling full community
            participation, integrated into the resettlement design.
            Although the project never experienced funding shortages
            (which ensured its timely and smooth implementation), most
            of the funds however, were disbursed on an advanced basis
            due to the late approval of the revised budget, thus
            creating confusion and implementation difficulties. It is
            outlined that livelihood development - the core of a
            resettlement program - should have been given the highest
            priority, instead, given the scale of resettlement, much
            focus was devoted to the physical construction and
            relocation components, which led to a late start of the
            livelihood development programs, and the slow livelihood recovery.
